intro: Licania egensis, commonly known as the Amazonian evergreen, is a tree species native to the dense rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 15-25 meters and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its bark is thick and fibrous, providing structural support and protection against pests. Licania egensis plays an important ecological role by offering habitat and food for various wildlife species.
